info.title: Omnivore API

get.description: Get a list of all your Locations

items.description: A Location resource contains data about a restaurant location.

id.description: The location's id within our database

get.description: Get the data for a Location that is currently attached to your account.

schema.description: A Location resource contains data about a restaurant location.

id.description: The location's id within our database

404.description: No Location found by that id

get.description: Get a list of all the Employees at a location

items.description: Resource for a Employee inside of a specific Location.

id.description: The employee's id as stored in the POS system.

check_name.description: The name of the employee as printed on a ticket.

first_name.description: The employee's first name as stored in the POS.

last_name.description: The employee's last name as stored in the POS.

Get a list of all the Tickets at a location

items.description:
Resource for restaurant tickets, also known as an order. Tickets are a sub-resource of Location.

Creating a Ticket is synonymouse with opening an order to be fulfilled by a restaurant.

Tickets a can be created, modified, replaced, and deleted.

id.description: The ticket's id as stored in the POS system

auto_send.description: When false, items aren't sent to kitchen until ticket is paid in full.

closed_at.description: Timestamp when the ticket was closed out. Null when 'open' is true.

guest_count.description: Number of guests on the Ticket

name.description: Alphanumeric indentifier for the Ticket. Note- unique amongst open Tickets.

open.description: Whether or not the Ticket has a remaining balance

opened_at.description: Timestamp when the ticket was opened

ticket_number.description: The number printed on the ticket

sub_total.description: Total cost of all Ticket Items.

service_charges.description: Other fees such as automatic gratuity or delivery fee.

id.description: The employee's id as stored in the POS system.

check_name.description: The name of the employee as printed on a ticket.

first_name.description: The employee's first name as stored in the POS.

last_name.description: The employee's last name as stored in the POS.

post.description:
Opens a new ticket using the submitted data.

Creating a new ticket will generate empty lists for all of its list-based sub-resources,
including `payments` and `items`. This enables you to generate resources that belong ot the Location,
but are comprised of information that is not top level Ticket data.

A ticket must be created with references to an `employee`, an `order-type`, a `table`, and a `revenue_center`.
These are submitted as top level fields with `ids` as the values.

table.description: ID of a table. Defaults to `null`

guest_count.description: Number of guests involved with the Ticket.

name.description: The name for the ticket to be displayed on the POS interface. Some POS system will ignore this. Defaults to `null`

auto_send.description: When false, items aren't sent to the kitchen until ticket is paid in full.

201.description: Returns the new ticket object with an assigned id.

post.description:
Void a ticket

Voids every item on the ticket and closes the ticket. Only tickets that do
not have sent items can be voided.

void.description: Set to true to void the ticket.

200.description: Returns the ticket with the void parameter set to true.

get.description: Get a list of all the Ticket Discounts on a Ticket

post.description:
Applies a Discount to the Ticket.

Available Discounts for application can be retrieved via the Discount definition resource at locations/{location_id}/discounts.

Open discounts can be submitted with the desired value for the Discount.

value.description: Value to be applied . For open discounts only

200.description: Returns the ticket with the new discount(s) added.

get.description: Get a list of all the Ticket Discounts on a Ticket
Get a list of all the Ticket Items on a Ticket.

post.description:
Adds a new Ticket Item to a Ticket.

Ticket Items inherit values from their Menu Item parents. It is required to attach a Menu Item to a Ticket Item when adding to a Ticket.

Ticket Items can be submitted with modifiers to override their default Menu configurations. (Example - Extra Ketchup)

Ticket Items can also be submitted with discounts that will apply to the newly created item.

Several Ticket Items can be created at a time by passing multiple input objects together as an array. The example payload on the right shows this.

price_level.description: The price level of the menu item being added.

comment.description: Any text, typically special instructions that aren't Available throught a modifiers

price_level.description: THe price level of the modifier.

comment.description: Any text, typically special instructions that aren’t available through a modifier.
Comment to be applied alongside the Discount

value.description: Value to be applied. For open discounts only

200.description: Returns the ticket with the new discount(s) added.

get.description: Gets a Ticket Item object

delete.description: Voids a Ticket Item from a Ticket if the Item has not been sent to the kitchen.

200.description: Returns full ticket with voided items removed
